match_data.recommendation: Strong match for an urgent burst-pipe repair. Quickly verify active plumbing license and confirm immediate response time. Discuss scope, parts availability, and any emergency/weekend surcharge to ensure the $150 budget aligns. If license is confirmed and budget expectations are aligned, proceed.
key_insights: Skills directly align with emergency burst-pipe work (Plumbing, Emergency Repair).
Availability is ideal: Available Now and weekends included.
Geographic fit: Worker prefers San Francisco, minimizing travel delays for urgent response.
Past performance suggests reliability and quality (4.8 rating over 127 gigs).
License is a hard requirement; confirmation is the primary gating factor.
Budget may require adjustment for emergency service; align expectations upfront.

response.title: Build e-commerce website for clothing store
response.description: I need a website developer to build a modern e-commerce website for my clothing store. I need it done in 3 weeks and my budget is around $1500.

response.title: Urgent plumber for kitchen sink leak
response.description: I need a plumber today at 5 PM to fix a leak in my kitchen sink. It's urgent.

response.explanation: A 3-week remote build for a modern e-commerce site with cart/checkout and payment integration typically requires ~100–140 hours. At global freelance rates of $40–$80/hour for competent web developers, a fair range is $4,000–$8,500; the suggested price assumes responsive UI, product/catalog setup, and solid payment integration without heavy custom features. Normal urgency and remote delivery keep pricing mid-market.

This is an urgent on-site plumbing gig in downtown Chicago, where licensed plumbers typically charge higher service-call and hourly rates. $300 fairly covers same-day scheduling, travel/parking, and about an hour of labor, with headroom up to $450 if extra time or parts are needed.

For a remote, normal-urgency project in a general 'Other' category, global market rates and typical small-to-mid scope (roughly 25–60 hours at $40–$70/hour) support a range of $1,200–$4,000. No urgency premium is applied; rates remain mid-market due to broad talent supply and standard complexity assumptions.
